result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M. Knapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *If revoked, 3 days of pretrial incarceration credit

miscConds.notes: *AODA  Assessment & comply with treatment recommendations from that assessment, if he has not had one in the last 12 months

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
*No contact with co-defendants, Christina Ross and Tomie Pizzino - to be left to the discretion of the agent

*Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions 
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
*Provide DNA sample

*Pay $100 fine plus costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Erik McFarland

Count 1:  Dismissed and Read In
Count 2:  Sentence Withheld and Placed on Probation
Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

9:17 AM Defendant Jason M. Knapp in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy  in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jason M. Knapp. 
Cases heard today are 22CF26 and 22CF188.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF26:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2 - Guilty 

22CF188:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 in 22CF26:  Possession of Methamphetamine 961.41(3g)(g)
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
**Dismissed and Read In:
Count 1 of 22CF26
Count 1 & 2 of 22CF188

ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing

BY THE COURT: 
22CF26:
Count 2:
Sentence Withheld
If revoked, 3 days of pretrial incarceration credit 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 24 Months -
**Conditions of Probation:
AODA  Assessment & comply with treatment recommendations from that assessment, if he has not had one in the last 12 months 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
No contact with co-defendants, Christina Ross and Tomie Pizzino - to be left to the discretion of the agent 
Pay $100 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Provide DNA sample 

20 days to appeal

Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing & Order to Bind Over filed by Atty Erik McFarland

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:03 PM Defendant Jason M. Knapp appeared in court, Attorney Erik John Mcfarland for Jason M. Knapp appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin, ADA Robert Jambois, appeared in court. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
